cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northeast, cross the north-west Florida coast on Thursday, then accelerate northeast just offshore the U.S. southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Florida coast near Indian Pass / Apalachicola area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch: Indian Pass westward to the Walton/Bay County line, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in force – only watches at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, then the coasts of GA, SC, NC and portions of the Mid-Atlantic (including Delmarva) as the cyclone moves offshore
weather_observation.wind: Low (6%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy conditions with gusts to 25-35 mph Saturday-Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected in upper Chesapeake Bay; minor coastal flooding possible at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible Saturday into Sunday as the system passes offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and waves in the lower Chesapeake and approaches; possible restrictions on pilotage and small-craft operations
